description: This file contains common timestamp parsing routines written in Shell script. Functions include obtaining the current time, extracting components (month, day, year, hour, minute, second) from a timestamp, and calculating differences in days and minutes between timestamps.

methods.name: get_current_time
methods.description: Returns the current timestamp in format MM:DD:YY_HH:MM:SS using the date command.

methods.name: get_month
methods.description: Extracts and returns the month component from a given timestamp string.

methods.name: get_day
methods.description: Extracts and returns the day component from a given timestamp string.

methods.name: get_year
methods.description: Extracts and returns the year component from a given timestamp string.

methods.name: get_hour
methods.description: Extracts and returns the hour component from a given timestamp string.

methods.name: get_min
methods.description: Extracts and returns the minutes component from a given timestamp string.

methods.name: get_sec
methods.description: Extracts and returns the seconds component from a given timestamp string.

methods.name: days_in_month
methods.description: Returns the number of days in a specified month.

methods.name: days_in_months
methods.description: Calculates total days in a range of months between two given months.

methods.name: days_from_basedate
methods.description: Calculates total days from a fixed base date (00-01-01) to the given timestamp.

methods.name: delta_days
methods.description: Compute the difference in days between two timestamps.

methods.name: mins_from_basedate
methods.description: Calculates total minutes from the base date to the timestamp, considering hours and minutes.

methods.name: delta_mins
methods.description: Compute the difference in minutes between two timestamps (hours and minutes only).
